block.p: If President Clinton really wants to raise the profile of the upcoming United Nations summit on the environment (''Clinton Urges Action on Global Warming,'' news article, May 10), he should begin by leading the charge for Congress to ratify the Convention on Biodiversity.

If President Clinton really wants to raise the profile of the upcoming United Nations summit on the environment (''Clinton Urges Action on Global Warming,'' news article, May 10), he should begin by leading the charge for Congress to ratify the Convention on Biodiversity.

Five years after the Earth Summit, the United States has yet to sign this landmark document that intends to conserve biological diversity and promote sustainable use of biological resources and sharing of the benefits of genetic resources. It is hypocritical of the United States to encourage other countries to follow the lead of Costa Rica when America has yet to demonstrate its own commitment.
